posts.title: Free To Be: A Juneteenth Reading List for the Youth!
posts.text: The Black protagonists, characters, and historical figures featured in this booklist dared to imagine freedom against all opposing factors even if they had to carve out their own path.

posts.title: The Woodson Project Booklist
posts.text: We invite readers to engage with these books which recognize and celebrate the histories of Black folks who were able to thrive in spite of the conditions that surrounded them.

posts.title: They Did It For The Culture: Children's Books of Black Cultural Icons Who Made a Difference for Their Community
posts.text: For Black History Month, introduce your kids to black figures who have deeply influenced modern-day American culture. Check our 2019 list of kids' biographies and look for the hashtag #NYPL4TheCulture on social media!

posts.title: More Than Grits: A Book List Illuminating African American Diversity
posts.text: African American culture is a mixture of many flavors and not just a single story narrative.

posts.title: DIY: How to Make a Papier Mâché Elephant
posts.text: A step-by-step guide for creating your own elephant, courtesy of the staff at the Throg's Neck Library!
